description:
I've tested several other diary apps and this one works the best. It has nice features and the fact it can work together with an Android app really sealed it for me.

The Android app is open source but the version on play store comes with ads unless you pay for it, but you could presumably build your own version without the ads. I decided to just pay for it.

It doesn't synchronize my itself but together with Syncthing it is all pretty seamless.
summary: Works great, and the Android companion app works great too

description: Crashes often after some interaction at time of writing.
I think this is the linux tool that has made my life really better. I love this app and for Christmas I think I will donate to the developer. Huge thank.
summary: I think this is an amazing software, recommended with anyone

description: A very good software to use not only like a diary but much more. It has a lot of interesting features. I like it a lot!

Pretty much checks all requirements for a diary app... stores data in a single file (easy to backup and sync), supports encryption (no 3rd party tools needed), supports formatting, links, theming and much more. Would definitely recommend
Please add the ability to reload existing diaries and delete them from the overview. I created some in wrong folders and they arent disappearing.
